revised_title: Electromagnetic Induction in Non-Uniform Conductors and Earth's Conductivity
tldr: The authors investigate the possibility of determining the electrical conductivity of the Earth from observed variations in the Earth's magnetic field. They develop a theory of electromagnetic induction in a non-uniform conductor and apply it to terrestrial magnetic variations. Their findings support the idea that there is an increase in conductivity with increasing depth beyond 250 km, suggesting a change in the Earth's composition at that depth.
